stories.text:
I have a friend that talks to me all day but usually over exaggerates and doesn’t always reveal stuff in a clear way. I often find corporate communications to be the same way. What can we as an industry do to better communicate nuances?

For example if Facebook could have better communicated the nuance dangers of getting addicted to Instagram the world would have been a safer place for teens.
stories.title: Ask HN: How can we better communicate nuance?
A Magnetic-Core Memory Shield for the Arduino (2018)

Why Are Glass Carboys Shattering Suddenly?
Interviewing Clerk Hakathon Runner-Up and Aviyel Dev Rel
Exhibition of Michelangelo’s Sistine Chapel Frescoes Is Coming to San Francisco

stories.text:
I'm struggling to draw a clear line in my head on when to use classes vs pure functions. I get the positives of having your functionality grouped and together in the class-based approach, but in recent projects I've been really burned by painful inheritance/mixins problems. So now I'm questioning if I should have gone pure functions all the way.

Could someone recommend some good articles / books / tutorials that touch on this topic?
stories.title: Ask HN: Recommend Reading on Classes vs. Functions
Veera Health (YC W21) is hiring full stack engineers
OM# – Visual Programming – Computer-Assisted Music Composition
Is Your Business Ready for Windows 11?
